revised_title: Archibald Garrod and the Discovery of Inborn Errors of Metabolism
tldr: The article discusses the life and work of Archibald Garrod, a pioneering medical scientist who discovered inborn errors of metabolism. Garrod's research on alkaptonuria, a rare metabolic disorder, laid the foundation for the field of human biochemical genetics. His ideas on biochemical individuality and disease were ahead of his time and only gained recognition after his death. The article highlights Garrod's contributions to science and the development of the field over the years.
